senses.ex: After a long workout, she consumed a large meal.

Tips.title: Context Matters
Tips.description: Use 'consume' when focusing on the amount or desire rather than the act of eating.
Tips.example: He consumed the whole cake in one sitting.

Tips.title: Intensity
Tips.description: 'Consume' can imply eating with great appetite or thirst.
Tips.example: The athletes consumed gallons of water post-marathon.

senses.ex: Running her business consumed all of her time.

Tips.title: Metaphorical Use
Tips.description: 'Consume' can suggest a resource is being used to its limit.
Tips.example: The project consumed a great deal of financial resources.

Tips.title: Negative Connotation
Tips.description: Sometimes 'consume' implies negative consequences of excessive use.
Tips.example: His constant travel consumed his savings rapidly.

senses.ex: The fire consumed the entire forest.

Tips.title: Total Destruction
Tips.description: 'Consume' often means something is destroyed so completely, it ceases to exist.
Tips.example: A plague consumed the crop yields that year.

Tips.title: Hyperbolic Expression
Tips.description: It can be used to exaggerate the extent of destruction or loss.
Tips.example: Their love was consumed by endless arguments.

senses.ex: She was completely consumed by her passion for music.

Tips.title: Emotional Involvement
Tips.description: 'Consume' suggests being absorbed by an emotion to the point of being controlled by it.

Tips.title: Complete Engagement
Tips.description: When someone's interest or activity 'consumes' them, it dominates their life or time.
Tips.example: Researching her family history has consumed her every weekend.

Deplete.wordDefinition:
Deplete means to use up all of something until there is none left. For example, you might deplete a resource, like oil or water.

Consume can be used for anything you use up, while deplete is specifically used when you're talking about using up a resource to the point where there is none left.

Devour.wordDefinition:
The words consume and devour both mean to eat or use up something, but devour implies a more intense or rapid consumption.

For example, you might consume a sandwich slowly, taking small bites and savoring each flavor, while you would devour a plate of french fries quickly and eagerly.

Consume is a more neutral and versatile term, while devour suggests a voracious or urgent appetite.

Eat.wordDefinition:
Consume means to use something up or take it in, while eat specifically refers to ingesting food or drink through the mouth.

We use consume when talking about things we use up, like energy or resources, such as "The factory consumes a lot of electricity" or "I consume a lot of water during my workouts.”

On the other hand, we use eat when referring to ingesting food or drink through the mouth, such as "I am going to eat this sandwich for lunch" or "Let's eat dinner together tonight.”

Overall, while consume has a broader meaning, eat is a specific type of consumption that pertains to food and drink.

Exhaust.wordDefinition:
Exhaust means to use up completely or to feel very tired or empty. For example, you may exhaust your energy or resources by working too hard or by doing too much.

Consume is applicable when referring to using resources while exhaust is applicable when referring to using up something completely or feeling very tired or empty.

Exploit.wordDefinition:
Exploit means to take advantage of something or someone for your own gain.

It can be used in a negative way when we exploit people or resources for profit, or it can be used in a positive way if we exploit our talents or opportunities to achieve success.

Consume refers to using things up or enjoying them, while exploit refers to taking advantage of them for our own benefit.

Imbibe.wordDefinition:
Imbibe means to drink, but usually with a sense of enjoyment or pleasure.

It is generally used to refer to liquids like water, juice, tea, or coffee. For example, we imbibe a cup of coffee to wake up in the morning or imbibe a cool drink to quench our thirst on a hot day.

Consume applies to solid or semi-solid substances, whereas imbibe applies to liquids that we enjoy or consume casually.

Ingest.wordDefinition:
Ingest specifically refers to the act of taking in food or drink through your mouth and swallowing it.

It's a more specific term that only applies to the consumption of food and drink. For example, you might ingest a lot of water when you're thirsty or ingest a piece of cake at a party.

Consume is a broader term that can apply to a wider range of things, while ingest is a more specific term that only applies to eating and drinking.

Swallow.wordDefinition:
Consume means to eat or drink something entirely, while the word swallow means to take food or drink into the stomach through the mouth.

For example, if you eat a whole pizza, you consumed the entire pizza. But if you took a bite and then swallowed it, you swallowed a piece of pizza.

Consume is more applicable when talking about eating a meal or drinking a beverage completely, while swallow is more commonly used when talking about taking medicine or swallowing small items such as a pill.

Use.wordDefinition:
Consume means to completely use up or destroy something, while use simply means to make use of something for a particular purpose without necessarily depleting it entirely.

You might consume food, meaning you eat all of it until it's gone, but you would use a tool to complete a project without necessarily breaking or destroying it.

Use is more applicable since it refers to a wider range of actions and objects, while consume is more specific and typically related to consumption of resources or goods.

quotes.Text: If you're not producing as much as you consume, or perhaps a little more, then clearly we cannot use the big organization of our society for the purpose of keeping you alive, because your life does not benefit us, and it can't be of very much use to yourself.
quotes.Title: Irish Playwright
quotes.Name: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.Text: You do indeed have a past, but not now! And, yes, you have a future, but not now! You can consume your now with thoughts of 'then' and 'maybe,' but that will keep you from the inner peace you could experience.
quotes.Title: American Psychologist
quotes.Name: Wayne Dyer

quotes.Text: We live in a world of things, and our only connection with them is that we know how to manipulate or to consume them.
quotes.Title: American Psychologist
quotes.Name: Erich Fromm

quotes.Text: Real estate is my life. It is my day job, if you will. But it consumes my nights and weekends, too.
quotes.Title: American Businesswoman
quotes.Name: Ivanka Trump

quotes.Text: The more you consume, the more insecure you are. It's the nature of the world.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Manoj Bhargava

quotes.Text: I worked very hard playing Arjun, and I was consumed by the character.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Shaheer Sheikh

quotes.Text: I've played many characters that have consumed me and owned me.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Irrfan Khan

quotes.Text: Basically, my life was music, and I was always consumed by it.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Billy Squier

quotes.Text: My life is very much consumed with work.
quotes.Title: Australian Actor
quotes.Name: Ryan Kwanten

quotes.Text: My life is consumed by racing.
quotes.Title: American Driver
quotes.Name: Michael Waltrip
